pullRequest.title: Passthrough special characters in thread pool docs
pullRequest.bodyText: Some of these characters are special to Asciidoctor and they ruin the rendering on this page. Instead, we use a macro to passthrough these characters without Asciidoctor applying any subtitutions to them. This commit then addresses some rendering issues in the thread pool docs.

commit.message:
Passthrough special characters in thread pool docs

Some of these characters are special to Asciidoctor and they ruin the
rendering on this page. Instead, we use a macro to passthrough these
characters without Asciidoctor applying any subtitutions to them. This
commit then addresses some rendering issues in the thread pool docs.

nodes.bodyText:
As-is, this leaves an annoying white space between 1 + and # of allocated processors:

I think this is because Asciidoctor adds a space for line breaks within a paragraph. You can get rid of it by. moving pass:[1 + ] to the following line:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                queue_size of `200`. The maximum size for this pool is `pass:[1 + ]`
          
          
            
                <<node.processors, `# of allocated processors`>>.
          
          
            
                queue_size of `200`. The maximum size for this pool is 
          
          
            
                `pass:[1 + ]`<<node.processors, `# of allocated processors`>>.
          
      
    
    
  


Not a big deal either way though.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -34,44 +34,44 @@ There are several thread pools, but the important ones include:
 `write`::
     For single-document index/delete/update and bulk requests. Thread pool type
     is `fixed` with a size of <<node.processors, `# of allocated processors`>>,
-    queue_size of `200`. The maximum size for this pool is `1 + `
+    queue_size of `200`. The maximum size for this pool is `pass:[1 + ]`
     <<node.processors, `# of allocated processors`>>.
